title: Seahawks head coach Mike Macdonald grew up in Scituate and dreamed of running the Red Sox
author: Trevor Hass
bullets: Seahawks head coach Mike Macdonald grew up in Scituate and once dreamed of being Red Sox's general manager.
Macdonald, 38, transitioned from a focus on baseball to coaching football after an ACL injury in high school.
He became head coach of the Seattle Seahawks in 2024, leading them to a 24-10 record and a Super Bowl appearance.

title: Watch: Patriots’ Super Bowl LX send-off rally
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Patriots' Super Bowl LX send-off rally held at Gillette Stadium with speeches from Robert Kraft and Mike Vrabel.
The team will depart to T.F. Green Airport in Rhode Island before flying to California for Super Bowl LX.
Super Bowl LX between the Patriots and Seahawks will take place on February 8 at Levi's Stadium, Santa Clara.

title: Carlton Davis gives his pitch for free agents to join Patriots this offseason
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Patriots cornerback Carlton Davis praises the team's culture and encourages free agents to join New England this offseason.
Davis highlights Coach Mike Vrabel's player-focused approach as a key factor in creating a supportive team environment.
The Patriots, with significant cap space, aim to attract top free agents like George Pickens and Jaelan Phillips.

title: Where does Milton Williams rank among Patriots’ 10 best free-agent signings ever?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Milton Williams ranks 8th among the Patriots' best free-agent signings, lauded for his impactful first season.
Williams signed a $104 million contract in 2025, including $63 million guaranteed, leading with strong defensive performances.
He recorded 5.5 sacks for the season and led in pressures, crucial to the Patriots' Super Bowl LX journey.

title: 8 lesser discussed potential trade deadline candidates that could make sense for Celtics
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics unlikely to make major trades ahead of Thursday's NBA deadline, according to ESPN's Bontemps and Windhorst.
Possible trade candidates for Celtics include Nic Claxton, Daniel Gafford, and Keon Ellis, focusing on big men additions.
Financial constraints limit Celtics, with most potential trades requiring complex deals due to luxury tax considerations.

title: Something in the Way Fest 2026: Live updates from Roadrunner
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Something in the Way Fest 2026 features two dozen indie and alt-rock bands at Boston's Roadrunner venue on Jan. 31 and Feb. 1.
Explosions in the Sky closed the festival with a 90-minute instrumental set, using atmospheric lighting to create emotional narratives.
Performers included Explosions in the Sky, The Hotelier, Angel Du$t, Tigers Jaw, GUV, Momma, How Much Art, and Febuary.

title: Why the Bruins practiced in a tent on Saturday in Florida
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Bruins practiced in a tent structure at Raymond James Stadium to maintain ice quality for Sunday's outdoor game.
The NHL set up a steel-framed, air-conditioned tent over the rink to manage Florida's climate and ensure suitable playing conditions.
Sunday's game temperatures are expected in the 30s, colder than the 2023 Winter Classic in Fenway, which was 51 degrees.

title: Boston ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest must-see moments
author: Annie Jonas and Samantha Genzer
bullets: Thousands gathered at Boston Common for 'ICE Out Everywhere' protest, urging an end to cooperation with ICE.
The protest was part of a nationwide campaign across over 300 cities, sparked by recent ICE-related deaths.
Local advocacy groups organized the rally, calling for nonviolent resistance and accountability from state officials.

title: Photos from Boston’s ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Over 1,000 people protested against ICE at Boston Common in 15-degree weather after a snowstorm.
The protest was organized by Mass 50501 as part of a series of nationwide demonstrations.
Protesters gathered at the State House with signs, participated in a march, and were joined by Somervilleâ€™s Good Trouble Brass Band.

title: Insider believes Red Sox have ‘another move in them’ this offseason to improve infield
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Boston Red Sox may pursue an additional infielder trade before the 2026 season, per MLB insider Jeff Passan.
Isaac Paredes and Christian Walker are potential trade targets, with Paredes fitting Red Sox's defensive needs.
The Red Sox have inquired about Cubs' Nico Hoerner and Matt Shaw, although a trade for Hoerner seems unlikely.
